com.mysql.fabric.jdbc

Interface JDBC4FabricMySQLConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.sql.Connection, ConnectionProperties, JDBC4MySQLConnection, MySQLConnection, java.sql.Wrapper
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JDBC4FabricMySQLConnectionProxy

    public interface JDBC4FabricMySQLConnection
extends JDBC4MySQLConnection

    • Method Detail

      • clearServerSelectionCriteria

        void clearServerSelectionCriteria()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Clear all the state that is used to determine which server to send queries to.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setShardKey

        void setShardKey(java.lang.String shardKey)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Set the shard key for the data being accessed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getShardKey

        java.lang.String getShardKey()
        Get the shard key for the data being accessed.

      • setShardTable

        void setShardTable(java.lang.String shardTable)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Set the table being accessed. Can be a table name or a "database.table" pair. The table must be known by Fabric as a sharded table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getShardTable

        java.lang.String getShardTable()
        Get the table being accessed.

      • setServerGroupName

        void setServerGroupName(java.lang.String serverGroupName)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Set the server group name to connect to. Direct server group selection is mutually exclusive of sharded data access.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getServerGroupName

        java.lang.String getServerGroupName()
        Get the server group name when using direct server group selection.

      • getCurrentServerGroup

        ServerGroup getCurrentServerGroup()
        Get the current server group.

      • clearQueryTables

        void clearQueryTables()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Clear the list of tables for the last query. This also clears the shard mapping/table and must be given again for the next query via setShardTable or .
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addQueryTable

        void addQueryTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Add a table to the set of tables used for the next query on this connection. This is used for:
        • Choosing a shard given the tables used
        • Preventing cross-shard queries
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getQueryTables

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getQueryTables()
        The set of tables to be used in the next query on this connection.
